entry.title: Re: Error Handling and Reprocessing of Odata through Application Interface Framework (AIF) Tool
entry.content: There is no standard way as such to monitor the RAP based oData. You can follow the same approach as given in the blog and link the AIF module with your RAP service implementation.

entry.title: Configuration steps to deactivate MRS
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Can you please let me know the configuration steps to deactivate MRS for work orders. When we try to assign a personnel number and save it we get message No Resource is available. Is there any configuration to deactivate it?

Regards,

Jaya

entry.title: Grey box while extracting documentation
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we recently discovered an issue when exporting books as word documents. 

When opening the document, a grey square appears on top of the screenshot (see attachement). 
We can not find a reason for this as this square does not belong to the template nor the bookpage itself.
The book pages originate from imported PPT slides, so there are no actual other objects on the bookpage.

The only reason we can think of is that the settings of the bookpage itself (under design) are affecting this. The background colour is turned on and set to grey. Is there a way we can adjust this in bulk as we have way too many slides to change this manually?
But even then, some bookpages don't have this issue even when the background is turned on and set to grey.

In our general book page settings, there is no background colour set.

Is there anything else we are missing? 

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Bookmarks in Fiori Report
entry.content:
Hi Felix,

I think the authorization for this is controlled by the Object S_WDR_ADM. You may need ACTVT 02 in order to manage shared bookmarks .

Best regards,

Katja

entry.title: SAP BTP Service manager - Multi tenancy - How to rotate generated DB credentials of HDI Container ?
entry.content:
Hello 

I have a CAP based multi tenant application. Using service manager, upon the subscription , it created the DB container and associated credentials. I am looking for an option to rotate this key- If it was a normal HDI instance , I could create a new key and binding - that would provide me with new DB credentials for the app to connect to . 

How to achieve the same here ? I looked at the Service manager API documentation and I am lost. 

Sree

entry.title: Re: The use of CDS Entity I_ELECTRONICDOC is not permitted.
entry.content: Hi PChacon - could you please provide a few more details - so PAC probably you are not looking at the product availability check - are you talking about the PAC electronic document (electronic invoicing?) for like Mexico?

entry.title: KB11N for prepayment cost transfer ?
entry.content: I’m not sure if using ‘KB11N’ to transfer the prepayment cost (cost element: 17400100) to another WBS does make sense in terms of cost management ? Because this cost element is not like usual project cost items but like the asset item.

entry.title: Re: RAP DETERMINATION handler METHOD stuck in Infinite re...
entry.content:
@junwu We fixed the solution by making the below changes,

We changed ,

determination set_allocation_status on save { update; create; field OnHoldQuantity; }

to

determination set_allocation_status on save { create; update; }

Hence, removing the Determination Trigger for Field Changes and keeping it exclusively for the Save Handler SAVE event, thereby it getting called only once at Saver Sequence SAVE event.

Still the question not answered is even though in the previous DETERMINATION Syntax the Field Change was for Field 'OnHoldQuantity' and in the MODIFY EML of this DETERMINATION Field 'OnHoldQuantity' was not changed instead it was other 2 fields which was changed, but still MODIFY EML was recursively calling itself ending into a LOOP, why so is still a mystery.

Thanks,

Sijin

entry.title: Re: Batch Split Valuation in Product Cost Controlling and Margin Analysis
entry.content:
Hi Li_Sen

I want to implement actual costing and split valuation by batches, therefore I guess I need to fill the valuation category with X (Automatic Batch) in all of the materials. However, when uploading the materials with migration cockpit, the price control is changed from S to V, and for actual costing to work properly they need price control S.

How should I configure everything properly?

Thanks. Regards,

entry.title: Re: The use of CDS Entity I_ELECTRONICDOC is not permitted.
entry.content: Jerry: It has already been resolved; your comment was very helpful, and another alternative was found. This is not for Mexico — we are developing E-invoice for non-localized countries (Central America) in the public cloud. For credit notes, the XML must be generated, and one of the required attributes is the UUID of the referenced invoice. The solution for retrieving this data is through a Z table that must be built for each non-localized country, where the standard updates the UUID returned by the PAC.

entry.title: Re: Accrual reversals before final settlement
entry.content:
Hi @sami3r ,

1. If the requirement is to reduce the accruals, use the manual delta accruals process. In the manual delta accrual settlement document, use the item category as Returns Items. This will post negative accruals.

2. If the requirement is not to proceed with any rebate settlement and want to close it without final settlement, in this case, set the status of the contract to logically deleted. Then run the accruals reversal for the contract(Tcode : WB2R_RAC)

Regards

Hari

Could you please let us know what was the approach you have taken for the rehire case. Thankyou!

entry.title: Introducing Object-Based Authorization (OBA) in SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
With the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS00, SAP delivers the new Object-Based Authorization (OBA) framework for Project System. This functionality provides a more granular and intuitive way to manage user access for specific project objects across selected transactions and use cases. OBA enhances security, improves control, and aligns authorization management with real-world project structures. 

Prerequisite for using Object-Based Authorization (OBA) 

To leverage Object-Based Authorizations (OBAs) within your project and network structures, you must first activate the feature through the relevant project or network profile settings. 

Begin by enabling the “Object-Based Authorization” flag within the configuration of a project profile or network profile. Once this flag is activated, you will be required to define a user group. This user group is automatically assigned Admin authorization to the project object during creation and cannot be changed. 

Typically, this group includes key stakeholders such as members of the Project Management Office (PMO) or designated administrators. These users consistently require elevated, “Admin-level” authorization across projects or networks, making the default assignment both efficient and secure. 

Networks created within a project automatically include two default user groups with admin authorization: 

  • The user group inherited from the project, based on the assignment in the project profile. 
  • The user group assigned directly within the network profile. 

If the network assignment is removed from the project, any inherited authorizations (from the Project or WBS elements) will also be removed from the network and its subordinate objects.  

Enabling OBAs for Existing Projects and Networks in SAP S/4HANA 

When Object-Based Authorizations (OBAs) are activated within a project or network profile, the functionality applies only to newly created projects and networks. However, if you need to introduce OBAs to projects or networks that are already in progress, additional steps are required. 

Steps to Enable OBAs for Ongoing Projects 

  1. Activate OBAs in the relevant project and network profiles 
    Ensure that the “Object-Based Authorization” setting is enabled for both the project and network profiles tied to the existing objects. 
  2.  Execute the migration report 
    Run the report RPSOBA_MIGRATE via transaction SA38 to apply Object-Based Authorizations to the selected existing projects and networks. 

Important Note 

When selecting projects in the RPSOBA_MIGRATE report, OBAs will automatically be enabled for all associated networks—as long as the corresponding network profiles permit it. This ensures a consistent and streamlined authorization structure across related project components. 

Supported Object Types 

OBAs can be assigned to the following key object types within Project System: 

  • Project Definition 
  • WBS Element 
  • Network Header 
  • Network Activity and Activity Element 

Other object types like Milestone, Material components, Service do not have separate Object-based authorization tab in Project Builder. These object types have OBA controls similar to their Parent Object. E.g.: - If a Milestone is assigned to WBS element then Milestone’s OBA controls are the same as the WBS OBA controls to which it is assigned. 

While OBA governs access at the object level, users must still hold the appropriate authorizations through their standard role-based authorization (PFCG). Both are evaluated simultaneously, meaning that OBA + Role Authorization = Access Granted (an “AND” condition in the authorization check). 

Inheritance of Object-Based Authorizations 

The OBA framework follows a hierarchical inheritance principle: 

  • OBAs assigned at a higher-level object (e.g., a WBS element) automatically propagate to all linked lower-level objects (e.g., assigned networks). 
  • Additional or more specific OBAs can be assigned locally at lower levels, and these too will be inherited further down the hierarchy. 

This ensures consistent, scalable access management across complex project structures. 

Assignment to Users and User Groups 

OBAs may be assigned to: 

  • Individual users, or 
  • User groups 

There is no distinction or prioritization between individual users and user groups; both are handled equally in OBA. Also, there is no prioritization of local assigned authorizations or inherited authorizations. 

Additionally, any user who ,creates a project, WBS or network, Network activities automatically added to the OBA list with Admin authorization for that object, ensuring they retain full control. For security reasons, users cannot modify their own OBA assignments. 

Authorization Types in OBA 

The following authorization levels can be assigned to users or user groups: 

  • Read – Allows viewing of project data 
  • Write – Allows editing of project data, but not altering authorizations 
  • Admin – Allows editing of data and managing authorizations 
  • No Authorization – Restricts both viewing and editing 

Additionally, users or groups with Write authorization may also be assigned the Create indicator. This is required for creating or assigning lower-level project objects within the relevant hierarchy.  

OBA requires at least read access to the Network Header in order to work on lower-level objects. To edit Network Activities, edit access to the Network Header is also necessary. 

Additionally, assigning a Network Header, Network Activities, or Network Activity Elements to a WBS Element requires Admin authorization on the respective WBS Element. 

Prioritizing of Authorization Types: 

The following priority applies to the authorization types: 

  1.  Priority: Read 
  2.  Priority: Write 
  3.  Priority: Admin
  4.  Priority: No authorization 

The authorization with the highest priority wins. This means: 

  • No Authorization has a higher priority than Admin. 
  • Admin  has a higher priority than Write.  
  • Write  has a higher priority than Read. 

 Helpful Notes  

  • 3646104 - Additional information on Object-Based Authorizations in Project System  
  • 3646087 - Restriction Note for Object-Based Authorizations in Project Systems

entry.title: Transitioning Projects from ACL to Object-Based Authorization (OBA)
entry.content:
With the introduction of Object-Based Authorization (OBA) in SAP S/4HANA, organizations can manage project-level access with far greater precision and control. Whether your existing projects use Access Control Lists (ACL) or have no access control configured at all, SAP provides a clear path to transition them into the OBA framework along with all associated sub-elements.

For More details on OBA, refer to blog Introducing Object-Based Authorization (OBA) in SA... - SAP Community

ACls are not part of SAP’s strategic architecture going forward and we do not plan any further investments into ACLs. Below are some advantages of OBA :-

  • Improved performance (because of abandonment of org units and equal prioritization of local vs inherited and user and user group authorizations)
  • Enabled usage in modern ODATA and CDS view based architectures (because of abandonment of org units and equal prioritization of local vs inherited and user and user group authorizations)
  • Streamlined logic (inheritance in all cases, and equal prioritization of local vs inherited and user and user group authorizations) similar to modernized authorization concepts in PPM

This article provides a structured overview of the transition process and highlights the key differences between ACL and OBA to support a smooth transition.

1. Activate OBA in Project and Network Profiles

The first step is to enable Object-Based Authorization within the Project Profile and Network Profile settings. Once OBA is activated:

  • The ACL section becomes disabled (greyed out) and can no longer be edited.
  • The change is irreversible; a profile cannot revert from OBA back to ACL.

This ensures that all future access control for the project is handled exclusively using the OBA framework.

2. Run the Transition Report

Next, execute the report RPSOBA_MIGRATE to transition  all relevant projects from ACL to OBA authorization concept. After successful execution, each project will be updated with the following default authorization assignments:

  • The User Group defined in the Project Profile is assigned Admin authorization at the Project Definition level, and this authorization is automatically inherited by all sub-objects.
  • The user executing the transition report is granted Admin authorization at the Project Definition level, also inherited by all sub-objects.
  • The User Group from the Network Profile receives Admin authorization at the Network Header level, with inheritance applied to its sub-elements.

This step ensures that administration rights are preserved and properly cascaded throughout the project hierarchy.

3. Archival of Legacy ACL Records

During transition, all deleted ACL records for the project and its sub-elements are stored in the table PSACL_TAB_MIG. This serves as a historical archive and can be referenced later if needed.

By following these steps, organizations can smoothly transition to the Object-Based Authorization model, benefiting from a more granular, scalable, and maintainable security structure within their project management framework.

Key Differences Between ACL and OBA in SAP S/4HANA

 While Object-Based Authorization (OBA) builds on the foundational concept of Access Control Lists (ACL), there are several important differences that customers should be aware of when transitioning from ACL to OBA.

1. Supported Authorization Objects

In OBA, authorizations can be assigned only to Users and User Groups.
The Authorization Group (Organization Unit)—previously available in ACL—is not supported in OBA.

For customers migrating older projects that contained organization unit–based authorization groups, these must be converted into User Groups and then assigned within the OBA framework to maintain equivalent access behaviour.

2. Inheritance Behaviour

OBA applies a stricter inheritance model compared to ACL.
In OBA, authorizations are always inherited from a parent object down to all of its subordinate objects.
This ensures consistent access across the project hierarchy but also means that selective blocking or non-inheritance—possible in ACL—is no longer supported.

3. Create vs. Write Access Controls

Under ACL, users who had write access implicitly also had create access.
OBA introduces greater flexibility by decoupling these permissions. With OBA, customers can explicitly decide whether a write authorization should include create access by setting the Create Indicator for the corresponding authorization type.

This allows more granular and secure control over user actions within the project structure.

entry.title: From Zero to Fiori: Building SAP Apps with AI Agents (And Why I Use Markdown Files Instead of MCP)
entry.content:
45 minutes.

That's how long it took to build a Customer Feedback & Complaint Management system on SAP BTP: 11 backend entities, 4 Fiori apps with 2,500+ lines of UI annotations, semantic coloring, and working navigation.

It's not ready to ship project - but solid base to start devloping.

I didn't write the code. I orchestrated 5 specialized AI agents while focusing on architecture decisions and error correction. The agents are Markdown files with specific instructions, not an MCP server, not a fine-tuned model.

This choice surprises people. Let me explain why it works.

The agent Markdown files are in my GitHub repository: https://github.com/michal-majer/sap-cap-fiori-ai-agents


The Real Problem: Generic AI Fails at SAP

Ask ChatGPT or Claude to "build a Fiori app" and watch it fail. The model will write outdated syntax, hallucinate file structures instead of using generators, skip authorization patterns, and forget annotations that make Fiori actually usable.

The reason is simple: SAP CAP and Fiori Elements have specific conventions that aren't well-represented in public training data. The models know JavaScript and OData in general, but they don't know that @ui.LineItem annotations need specific ordering, or that Fiori generators create manifest.json files you shouldn't edit manually.

Generic prompts produce generic (broken) code.

Why Markdown Agents Instead of MCP?

Model Context Protocol is powerful. It lets AI tools call external services, access databases, and execute actions. So why am I using plain text files?

Three reasons:

1. Portability across AI interfaces

My Markdown agents work in Claude, in Cursor, in Windsurf, in any AI tool that accepts context files. When I switch tools (which happens often during experimentation), my agents come with me. No reconfiguration, no server setup.

2. Transparency and version control

Every instruction my agent follows is visible in a .md file I can read, edit, and commit to Git. When the AI makes a mistake, I can trace it back to which rule was missing or unclear. With MCP, the logic lives in server code. That's fine for stable integrations, but during iteration I need to see exactly what the AI "knows."

3. Lower barrier to iteration

Changing agent behavior means editing text. I can do it mid-session. "Add a rule: always use @CDS.localized for text fields" takes 10 seconds. Building this into an MCP server would require deployment cycles.

MCP makes sense for production integrations where you need real-time data access or external API calls. For development workflows where the AI manipulates local files, Markdown agents are faster to iterate.

The Agent Architecture

Five Markdown files, each with a specific role:

Full Stack Orchestrator breaks requirements into tasks and asks clarifying questions before any code gets written. It enforces the planning phase that developers usually skip.

SAP CAP Developer handles schema.cds and service.cds. It knows authorization patterns, associations, and generates mock data automatically.

SAP Fiori Designer decides which floorplans fit the use case. List Report for the Support Workbench, Object Page for complaint details, Worklist for the Customer Portal.

SAP Fiori Scaffolder has one strict rule: never create Fiori file structures manually. It uses Yeoman generators because manually written manifest.json files always have subtle bugs.

Fiori Elements Developer adds UI annotations: @UI.LineItem, @UI.SelectionField, @UI.FieldGroup, and criticality coloring. This is where raw IDs become human-readabledropdowns.

The Exact Prompts I Used

Here's the actual conversation flow from my session:

Initial prompt to Orchestrator:

 
Develop a SAP CAP application for managing customer feedback and complaints. The application should allow customers to submit feedback, enable support staff to categorize, assign, and resolve issues, and provide reporting on trends and recurring problems. Ensure a clean data model, CRUD services, and REST/OData endpoints for integration. @./ai/sap-full-stack-orchestrator

Phase 1: Requirements gathering

The Orchestrator didn't write any code. Instead, it asked clarifying questions:

  • What user roles do we need? → Customer, Support Staff, Manager, Admin
  • What is the lifecycle of a complaint? → Submit → Categorize → Assign → Resolve, with reopen capability
  • Do customers have BTP accounts? → Yes, managed internally
  • Multi-language support? → English only, single-tenant

After I answered, the Orchestrator produced a detailed implementation plan covering all phases. I reviewed it, asked for adjustments, and approved.

Phase 2-6: Backend development

The CAP Developer agent took over. It generated:

  • db/schema.cds with 11 entities
  • 8 CSV files with seed data
  • 5 service definitions (customer, support, manager, admin, analytics)
  • Service handlers with business logic
  • Authorization rules in access-control.cds

I ran cds watch after each major step. When the Customers endpoint returned 403, I pasted the error. The agent found the missing authorization scope and fixed it.

Phase 7: Frontend scaffolding

This is where the AI initially went off track:

 
Stop. Please use generator.
Please follow guide in @sap-fiori-scaffolder.md and use fiori-elements-writer

The AI had tried to create Fiori folder structures manually. After my correction, it installed @sap-ux/fiori-elements-writer and generated all 4 apps using the official SAP tooling. The resulting manifest.json files were correctly configured for deployment.

Phase 8: UI annotations

 
Let's go to the next phase, please create perfect fiori application. @.ai/sap-fiori-elements-developer.md

The Fiori Elements Developer agent scanned all OData services and generated 2,500+ lines of annotations: labels, value helps, criticality coloring, header facets, conditional actions, and organized object pages.

Error correction pattern:

I have some errors in admin-console application.RoutingServiceFactory-dbg.js:61 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'getMetaModel')

The AI immediately identified the issue: manifest.json had a named model "Complaints" instead of the default unnamed model "". Fixed in under a minute.

Triggering annotation phase:

Let's go to the next phase, please create perfect fiori application. @.ai/sap-fiori-elements-developer.md

What Got Generated

 

  • 11 database entities (Customers, Complaints, Categories, Priorities, Statuses, StatusTransitions, Comments, Attachments, StatusHistory, SupportStaff, ComplaintAnalytics)
  • 5 OData services with role-based access
  • 4 Fiori Elements apps
  • 2,500+ lines of UI annotations
  • 8 CSV files with seed data
  • 6 mocked users for testing

The Data Model
The CAP Developer agent generated a clean domain model following CAP conventions:

amespace customer.complaints;

using { managed, cuid, User, Country } from '@sap/cds/common';

/**
 * CUSTOMERS
 * Users who submit and track feedback/complaints
 */
entity Customers : cuid, managed {
  customerNumber   : String(20);                 // Auto-generated (e.g., CUST-20251207-00001)
  firstName        : String(100) @mandatory;
  lastName         : String(100) @mandatory;
  email            : String(256) @mandatory;     // BTP account email
  phone            : String(50);
  company          : String(200);

  // BTP Integration
  btpUserId        : String(256) @mandatory;     // BTP user ID for authentication
  isActive         : Boolean default true;

  // Relationships
  complaints       : Composition of many Complaints on complaints.customer = $self;
}

/**
 * COMPLAINTS
 * Core entity for customer feedback and complaints
 */
entity Complaints : cuid, managed {
  complaintNumber  : String(30) not null;        // Auto-generated (e.g., CMP-20251207-00001)

  // Basic Information
  title            : String(200) @mandatory;
  description      : String(5000) @mandatory @UI.MultiLineText;

  // Classification
  category         : Association to Categories @mandatory;
  priority         : Association to Priorities @mandatory;
  status           : Association to Statuses @mandatory;

  // Assignment
  customer         : Association to Customers @mandatory;
  assignedTo       : Association to SupportStaff;
  assignedBy       : Association to SupportStaff;  // Manager who assigned
  assignedAt       : DateTime;

  // Dates
  submittedDate    : DateTime @mandatory @cds.on.insert: $now;
  targetDate       : Date;                        // Expected resolution date
  resolvedDate     : DateTime;
  closedDate       : DateTime;
  reopenedDate     : DateTime;

  // Resolution
  resolutionNotes  : String(5000) @UI.MultiLineText;
  rootCause        : String(1000);
  correctiveAction : String(1000);

  // Metrics (virtual fields calculated in handlers)
  virtual daysOpen        : Integer;
  virtual isOverdue       : Boolean;
  virtual statusCriticality: Integer;
  virtual priorityCriticality: Integer;

  // Relationships
  comments         : Composition of many Comments on comments.complaint = $self;
  attachments      : Composition of many Attachments on attachments.complaint = $self;
  history          : Composition of many StatusHistory on history.complaint = $self;
}

/**
 * CATEGORIES
 * Hierarchical categorization system
 */
entity Categories : cuid {
  code             : String(20) not null;
  name             : String(100) not null;
  description      : String(500);

  // Hierarchy support
  parent           : Association to Categories;
  children         : Composition of many Categories on children.parent = $self;

  // Routing
  defaultPriority  : Association to Priorities;
  autoAssignTo     : Association to SupportStaff;  // Auto-assign to specific staff

  isActive         : Boolean default true;
  sortOrder        : Integer default 0;
}

/**
 * PRIORITIES
 * Priority levels for complaints
 */
entity Priorities : cuid {
  code             : String(20) not null;
  name             : String(100) not null;
  description      : String(500);

  // SLA Configuration
  slaHours         : Integer;                     // Target resolution time in hours
  escalateAfterHours: Integer;                    // Auto-escalate if not resolved

  // Display
  criticality      : Integer default 0;           // 0=Grey, 1=Red, 2=Orange, 3=Green
  sortOrder        : Integer default 0;
  isActive         : Boolean default true;
}

/**
 * STATUSES
 * Workflow states for complaints
 */
entity Statuses : cuid {
  code             : String(20) not null;
  name             : String(100) not null;
  description      : String(500);

  // Workflow Control
  isInitialStatus  : Boolean default false;       // New complaints start here
  isFinalStatus    : Boolean default false;       // Terminal states
  canReopen        : Boolean default false;       // Can reopen from this status

  // Valid transitions
  allowedTransitions: Association to many StatusTransitions on allowedTransitions.fromStatus = $self;

  // Display
  criticality      : Integer default 0;
  sortOrder        : Integer default 0;
  isActive         : Boolean default true;
}

/**
 * STATUS TRANSITIONS
 * Allowed state transitions
 */
entity StatusTransitions : cuid {
  fromStatus       : Association to Statuses @mandatory;
  toStatus         : Association to Statuses @mandatory;
  requiredRole     : String(50);                  // Role required for transition
  requiresComment  : Boolean default false;
  isActive         : Boolean default true;
}

/**
 * COMMENTS
 * Timeline of updates and communications
 */
entity Comments : cuid, managed {
  complaint        : Association to Complaints @mandatory;
  commentText      : String(5000) @mandatory @UI.MultiLineText;

  // Categorization
  commentType      : String(50) default 'UPDATE'; // UPDATE, INTERNAL, CUSTOMER, SYSTEM
  isInternal       : Boolean default false;       // Hide from customer
  isSystemGenerated: Boolean default false;       // Auto-generated

  // User info captured at creation time
  authorName       : String(200);
  authorRole       : String(50);
}

/**
 * ATTACHMENTS
 * File attachments for complaints
 */
entity Attachments : cuid, managed {
  complaint        : Association to Complaints @mandatory;

  @Core.MediaType: mediaType
  @Core.ContentDisposition.Filename: filename
  content          : LargeBinary;

  @Core.IsMediaType
  mediaType        : String;
  filename         : String(256);
  fileSize         : Integer;
  description      : String(500);
}

/**
 * STATUS HISTORY
 * Audit trail of status changes
 */
entity StatusHistory : cuid {
  complaint        : Association to Complaints @mandatory;
  fromStatus       : Association to Statuses;
  toStatus         : Association to Statuses @mandatory;
  changedAt        : DateTime @mandatory @cds.on.insert: $now;
  changedBy        : String(256);                 // BTP user ID
  changedByName    : String(200);
  reason           : String(1000);
}

/**
 * SUPPORT STAFF
 * Internal users handling complaints
 */
entity SupportStaff : cuid, managed {
  staffNumber      : String(20);
  firstName        : String(100) @mandatory;
  lastName         : String(100) @mandatory;
  email            : String(256) @mandatory;
  phone            : String(50);

  // BTP Integration
  btpUserId        : String(256) @mandatory;

  // Role & Capacity
  role             : String(50) @mandatory;       // SUPPORT, MANAGER, ADMIN
  department       : String(100);
  isActive         : Boolean default true;
  maxConcurrentCases: Integer default 20;

  // Specialization
  specializations  : Association to many Categories on specializations.autoAssignTo = $self;

  // Metrics
  virtual currentCaseload: Integer;
  virtual avgResolutionDays: Decimal(5,2);
}

/**
 * ANALYTICS VIEWS
 * Pre-aggregated data for reporting
 */
@readonly
entity ComplaintAnalytics as projection on Complaints {
  key ID,
  complaintNumber,
  category.code as categoryCode,
  category.name as categoryName,
  priority.code as priorityCode,
  priority.name as priorityName,
  status.code as statusCode,
  status.name as statusName,
  assignedTo.ID as assignedToID,
  assignedTo.firstName || ' ' || assignedTo.lastName as assignedToName : String(200),
  submittedDate,
  resolvedDate,
  closedDate,
  daysOpen,
  isOverdue
};

Preview of one of the application after using Fiori Elements Developer agent:

List PageObject Page

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


What I Learned

Planning time isn't wasted time. The Orchestrator agent spent 5 minutes asking about user roles, complaint lifecycles, and entity relationships before writing any code. Skipping this produces apps that need restructuring later.

Explicit rules beat implicit knowledge. I added "always generate mock CSV data" to the CAP Developer agent after sessions where the AI forgot. Now it never forgets. Every bug becomes a rule.

The AI doesn't know what it doesn't know. It won't tell you it's uncertain about Fiori annotation syntax. It will confidently write something wrong. Your job is recognizing when output looks suspicious and asking for verification or alternatives.

Human oversight scales the bottleneck, doesn't remove it. You still need to understand CAP and Fiori to review what the agents produce. The speedup comes from not typing boilerplate, not from removing the need for expertise.

Correction prompts are shorter than initial prompts. Once the AI has context, you can say "fix authorization for admin" instead of explaining the entire access control model. The AI remembers what it built.

Try It Yourself

The agent Markdown files are in my GitHub repository: https://github.com/michal-majer/sap-cap-fiori-ai-agents

Prerequisites:

  • Visual Studio Code with an AI extension that supports file context (Claude Dev, Cursor, or similar)
  • Choose between Claude Opus 4.5 / Sonnet 4.5 or Gemini Pro 3
  • Node.js
  • Basic familiarity with SAP CAP (you need to recognize when output is wrong)

Drop the .md files in your project root, start a session, and give the Orchestrator a business requirement. Watch how it decomposes the task before coding begins.

Video walkthrough: youtube.com

What should I build agents for next?
What errors did you encounter?
Which agent was most useful?

Drop a comment 🙂

entry.title: Customer Conversations: SAP SuccessFactors @ Insurance Corporation of British Columbia
entry.content:
Join us for an SAP Customer Conversation featuring the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia (ICBC), where you'll hear firsthand about their migration from SAP ECC to SAP SuccessFactors. ICBC will share how they managed a tight timeline, reworked business processes to align with the cloud model, and achieved streamlined HR operations, improved compliance, enhanced user experience, and 99.8% reporting accuracy from SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll.

The session will also explore candid insights into what worked well, the challenges faced during implementation, and their future plans around Talent Intelligence Hub and People Intelligence — engage in this discussion with your peers for valuable lessons on accelerating your own digital journey.

Register here

entry.title: Enabling your HR Business Transformation: Navigating Sustainment & Value Management
entry.content:
To get the best out of your Cloud Technology it is a must to establish a set of tactical programs and activities that will continuously support your organization’s move to the cloud. This webinar focuses on two of the Key Tactical Elements of the Business Transformation Framework to help sustain identified programs for a successful ongoing cloud enabled organization. The focus areas for this webcast’s agenda are:

1. Sustainment: Formalize a team structure with clear roles, and responsibilities from HR and IT to maintain your solution relevant, updated and providing business results

2. Value Management: How to define an approach to identify, track and measure transformation outcomes.

By getting these tactical elements right from the beginning, HR Teams and Organizations will ensure a successful implementation and ongoing sustainment of Cloud Technology. Listen from our experts on some of the industry leading practices that have worked for several other organizations like yours. This 60-minute session is designed to equip you with action items to drive your organization’s transformation most effectively and avoid common pitfalls, followed by a Q&A session at the end. 

Register here

entry.title: Re: End-of-Month Rule: Charging Subscriptions Starting on the 29th, 30th, or 31st of a Month
entry.content:
Hi,

I cannot understand the logic behind the end-of-the-month rule. Why, when a subscription starts on the 29th, 30th, or 31st, is the billing period shifted in both prorated and free periods? Is there a way to keep the billing periods, for a yearly billing period as an example, if the subscription starts on 29.12.2025, the billing periods will be as follows:
1. 29.12.2025 - 31.12.2025 - prorated amount

2. 01.01.2026 31.12.2026 - full amount

When, in the real world, if the contract lasts for one year, the entire duration of the contract is 29.12.2025T00:00:00 to 28.12.2025T23:59:59; thus, the billing period should have been 29.12.2025 - 28.12.2026. 

It would be nice to understand why. 

Cheers.

entry.title: Re: S/4Hana cloud public - Linked a manual supplier invoi...
entry.content:
Good day @EmmanuelDeniau 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references for more details:

Manage Purchase Contracts, App Extensibility: Manage Purchase Contracts, KBA 2700132, KBA 3588033

In summary, the fields you see are technically unrelated to MM purchase contract, so you cannot use them to link the invoice to your purchase contract. Which also explains why they appear grey. They belong to provider contracts used in Contract Accounting & Invoicing and Event Based Revenue Recognition. These contracts are created in a different in a different business area and are used as profitability characteristics and not as purchasing objects.

The public cloud offers you the option to create supplier invoices:

  • Where you can reference to a purchase order, limit item, freight order, service entry sheet, or
  • Without reference, by posting directly to G/L, material or asset accounts

So, if you want the contract to be updated and monitored through standard procurement analytics, you need at least a simple PO that points to the contract and then post the invoice against that PO.

However, an option I recommend is to keep standard contract consumption. You can achieve this by:

  1. Using Manage Purchase Contracts to maintain your purchase contract as usual.
  2. For each of the invoice you receive without a classic PO, you should create a simple PO, for example, a limit item that references the contract.
  3. Post the supplier invoice in Create Supplier Invoice with reference to that PO. That will enable contract consumption and reporting to now work.

 

Here is a step-by-step approach you can consider taking:

Open the Create Supplier Invoice app and create a new Invoice without referencing a PO and add a G/L Account Item.

On the G/L item, click on Additional Details

and then link the Assign Profitability Segment.

In the pop up, expand other and you will see provider contract/Contract Item greyed out.

This demonstrates that these fields are profitability characteristics and not MM purchase contract input fields.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Still problems with bindung in SAP Document Reporting Complance after SAP solved the main proble
entry.content: All affected customers should have gotten an email and explaining the controls we put in place to prevent it from happening again: We have implemented a technical control that completely forbids the execution of this type of manual command directly on our production infrastructure. Configuration changes must go through our automated CI/CD pipeline. This enforces a mandatory approval process and a "four-eyes principle" (peer review) before any change is deployed to production

entry.title: Export and Import statements using memory id Help
entry.content:
I need some help with to ascertain why logic works for one shipping point but not the other during delivery creation.  During delivery creation we call FM EXIT_SAPL0VRF_001  and have the following statements.

DATA: V_CUST_FLAG TYPE C VALUE 'N',
             V_FIXT_FLAG TYPE C VALUE 'N',
             V_CUST_RTE  TYPE C.

There is other code, but I have check via debug and the code below is getting hit for both shipping points.

V_CUST_FLAG = 'Y'.

 EXPORT P1 = V_CUST_FLAG TO MEMORY ID V_CUST_RTE.

Within MV50AFZ1 routine USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE  we have the following code.

DATA: V_CUST_FLAG TYPE C,
             V_CUST_RTE  TYPE C.

IMPORT P1 = V_CUST_FLAG FROM MEMORY ID V_CUST_RTE.

When the shipping point is FKP V_CUST_FLG is populated with Y, but when the shipping point is another value this field is blank.  Does anyone have any thoughts why this works for one shipping point but not the other.

entry.title: IDoc Reaches SAP PI but No cXML Message Generated
entry.content:
I am working on an SAP PI/PO scenario where an outbound IDoc needs to be converted to cXML and sent to our partner’s Boomi endpoint.

My sender IDoc channel is working fine, and the mapping executes successfully.
But the receiver HTTP channel (CC_RCV_XXXX) stays in red status, and no cXML is being delivered to the endpoint. but in Open Message i can the CXML file. and status is waiting with 400 after that it is successful with 401 i

What I see

  • The Connection Test in the receiver channel shows “Connection OK.”

  • But the channel status in monitoring is red.

  • Runtime messages fail before the cXML gets delivered.

  • The partner endpoint is reachable and responds in Postman.

What I need help with

Why does the communication channel remain red, even when the connection test succeeds?

What are the possible runtime issues (authentication method, URL format, Content-Type, SSL, mapping, HTTP error codes, etc.) that can cause:

  • Ping OK, but

  • Actual message delivery failing, causing the channel to stay red?

If anyone has run into this type of issue, please share what the root cause was or what logs I should focus on.

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: goods receipt from an inbound delivery with a QR code.
entry.content:
Good day @0uTY 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references for more details:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/aff0b3f5f46c42a2b2c0fabfc233bab2/764084c4475247f3ac2037d69d9df743.html?locale=en-US

Check out this Blog: SAP S/4HANA Cloud – Output Management - Barcodes and QR Codes on forms

The public cloud does not provide a print/QR button in Display Inbound Delivery. If you need your own QR labels, you must design an output form with a barcode/QR field through Output Management and print that externally.

You can use it by tapping the scan icon in the Inbound Delivery field and scanning a QR/barcode printed on the delivery note or label.

Open the Post Goods Receipt for Inbound Delivery app

Then you need to scan the inbound delivery by tapping the scan icon. Allow the browser client to use the camera. Point the camera at the QR/barcode on the supplier’s delivery note or label. Then the app fills the Inbound Delivery field with the scanned value.

Thereafter, the app now suggests the inbound delivery and its items. You can adjust quantities if you need and post to the goods receipt.

 

Best regards

Chris

Raj

entry.title: Re: Send the BGRFC Queue in error ABAP code
entry.content:
As far as I understand (after debug of BGRFC_DEST_SHIP), there are only 2 cases with bgRFC:

  1. "Managed" = to get a red flag in SBGRFCMON, you must trigger a short dump via a classic exception or a class-based exception (better than WAIT).
  2. "Unmanaged = block the queue via cl_bgrfc_server=>lock_queue_during_execution( ), store the error message into a custom table and create a user interface to display this error and unlock the queue. SBGRFCMON only displays the information that the queue is blocked.

SBGRFCMON case 1:

SBGRFCMON case 2:

entry.title: Re: Unleashing the Power of Trusted Data: SAP 2025 TechEd Announces Enhanced Data Product Capabiliti
entry.content:
Hello Rupak and Samuel.

Yes, your point here - How do we use DP Studio to extend SAP Managed Data product - is the goal with DP studio. Mainly to help customers create derived data products from the managed data products + third party data. 

I am not entirely sure the details on you specific question.  From a data product studio perspect, we do not yet have a plan for Git integration versioning.  But note, this is a new solution being released. We do have tool internal versioning features and plan to offer upload/download functionality, so a customer could theoretically develop Their own Git integration.   Also, we version the data product definition file, not the individual artifacts. For the artifacts, there will be coexisting mayor versions but minor/patch changes will be overwritten.

Hope this helps.

entry.title: Re: Help Needed: Configuring Rule-Based Reclassification...
entry.content:
Hi Daniel,

Reclassification methods are defined with the configuration step "Define Reclassification Method" that is located in the implementation guide (On Premise) or in "Manage your Solution" (Cloud).

You can find the rules that are delivered with the 1SG content in an excel file (2023_How_To_Display_Configuration_Content_S4HGR_SAP_V1.xlsx) attached to the note https://me.sap.com/notes/2659672 (On Premise) or the file 2408_How_To_Display_Configuration_Content_S4HGR_V1.xlsx attached to the note https://me.sap.com/notes/2659656 (Cloud).

This overview in Excel should really help to understand the logic of the defined rules.

See also the online documentation where the automatic postings are described: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/90c07e91c7a64f328be3fd6b48955b13/5ce06895106a463ca073fddae0f7a473.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US 

Hope this helps.

Best regards,

Grégoire

entry.title: Re: SBGRFCMON "Unit can be executed" (if not enough Work Processes)
entry.content:
The error happened in my ABAP Trial 7.52 SP 04, which had few dialog work processes.

There is no error logged, except in SLG1:

Instance vhcalnplci_NPL_00: 3 dialog work process(es) available (BGRFC026)
Instance vhcalnplci_NPL_00: 0 / 1 inbound scheduler(s) and 0 / 1 outbound scheduler(s) started (BGRFC027)

My solution was to increase the number of usable dialog workprocesses via the profile parameter rdisp/wp_no_dia (I have chosen 6, it was default 2 before), and to restart the server.

SM50:

After that, the bgRFC units could start automatically and there was no more log in SLG1.

NB: maybe it's also possible to define a higher percent of dialog workprocesses which can be used by RFC.

entry.title: Output Management - Send Billing Document via email but print if Buyer-Party has no E-Mail
entry.content:
I would like to set the output parameter determination so that (customer) billing documents are sent by email. If no email address is maintained for the Buyer-Party, the invoice should be printed. If an email address is maintained  for the Buyer-Party, no printing should take place.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Output Management - Send Billing Document via email b...
entry.content:
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the system follows this hierarchy for email address determination:

  1. Email recipient maintained directly in Output Parameter Determination (highest priority)
  2. Default email address from the Buyer-Party business partner master data
  3. Contact person email addresses 
To configure billing document output so that documents are emailed when a Buyer-Party email exists or printed when no email is maintained, you'll need to set up conditional channel determination in the Output Parameter Determination app.
  1. Open the Output Parameter Determination app and select Billing Document from the "Show Rules for" dropdown
  2. Navigate to the Channel determination step and create two rules with specific logic:
  3. Rule 1 - Email Channel (Priority Rule):
  • Output Type: BILLING_DOCUMENT
  • Role: RE (Buyer-Party)
  • Channel: EMAIL
  • Exclusive Indicator: X (This prevents printing when email is available)

    4. Rule 2 - Print Channel:

  • Output Type: BILLING_DOCUMENT
  • Role: RE (Buyer-Party)
  • Channel: PRINT
  • Exclusive Indicator: - (Not exclusive)

     5. In the Email Recipient determination step :

  • Output Type: BILLING_DOCUMENT
  • Role: RE
  • Email Type Code: TO
  • Email Address: Select "Default Email Address" from expressions

To configure this:

  1. Open the context menu for Email Address and choose Select Expressions
  2. Set Application Name to OPD_APOC_SYSTEM
  3. Set Expression Type to Constant
  4. Choose Search and select Default Email Address

    6. In the Receiver determination step:

  • Output Type: BILLING_DOCUMENT
  • Receiver Role: RE (Buyer-Party)

You can use all these documents as reference: 

  • Output Parameter Determination
  • 3631820 - Send billing document emails to the recipient's email address maintained in the business partner master data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition.
  • Setting Up Output Management - 1LQ Set Up Guide
  • How to Add Additional Email Recipients for Billing Documents by Using Custom Logic | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: Common configuration issues: Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Samir_Rai    Like most S/4HANA Private Cloud customers , the Global User ID is not used and not filled in SU01.  If we wanted it to be filled, we would need implementing some IPS job with S/4PCE as a target,  to only update only Global User ID, without touching other attributes. I don't believe this step is desctibed nowhere in the documentation Joule for S/4 PCE. The only IPS job is for synchronising S/4HANA PCE with Build Workzone, correct.

So if we use your trick described above to exclude Global User ID from the IPS transformation file from S/4PCE to buildWorkzone and only use email adress, it becomes no longer mandatory to have Global User ID synchronised and filled in SU01 ? Is it a correct assumption ?

entry.title: Re: Joule provisioning with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using Cloud Integration Automation ser
entry.content:
Hello @abhyarthana 

According to the offcial docuemntation, in transaction SU01 in S/4HANA the External user id (UID) must matches the Global User ID maintained in SAP Cloud Identity Services, but i do not see any step in the CIAS to ensure that synchronisation.   I am missing something here. There should be some kind of Identity Provisioning job to only update the externaal User ID , right ? Most Rise S/4HANA PCE customers dont  use that the External User ID, how is it filled ?  Thank you

entry.title: SAP Manufacturing Execution 15.5.036 Buyoff "reject allowed" is unchecked
entry.content:
SAP Manufacturing Execution 15.5.036 Buyoff "rejected allowed" is unchecked. I have created anew buyoff and have not selected "reject allowed" check box still user is gets option to reject and is able to reject buyoff message in message board.

in my scenario I like operators to discuss and work in case required and later they can request to accept buy off for 4Eye principle. if this check box does not behave differently when checked or unchecked. I don't see the reason of this .

entry.title: Onboarding Reminder Emails Settings - reminders trigger
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am getting quite confused with the email reminders, especially when they are being triggered

If my settings are below:

Set reminder before the due date - ticked:

  •  "Frequency of reminders in days" = 3
  • "Number of reminders to be sent" = 0

 Set reminder after due date - ticked:

  •  "Frequency of reminders in days" = 3
  • "Number of reminders to be sent" = 10

Does the above result in:

Scenario: Due date of the task is 17 December  and task is assigned 1 December

  • Set reminder before the due date:

a) The reminder is sent every 3 days from the day the task is created and assigned to the user 

Scenario: Reminder email gets triggered 4th December (i.e. 3 days after the task is assigned) and every 3 days from the 4th?

OR

b) reminders start to trigger only 3 days before the due date set in Manage Data and then every 3 days leading up to the due date

Scenario: Reminder email gets from 14th (i.e. 3 days before 17 Dec due date) and then every 3 days from the 14th?

 

  •  Set reminder after due date:

a) The reminder is sent every 3 days from the day the task is due and up to 10 notifications is sent every 3 days. After 10 notifications are sent then the reminders stop even if the task is still pending for completion?

Scenario: Reminder email gets triggered 17 December and every 3 days from the 17th? OR Reminder email gets triggered 1 day after the due date so from 18 Dec and every 3 days from 18th?

@Gopinath_Murugaiyan @akarshn your expertise and advice would be greatly appreciated. Client needs clarity for testing purposes

entry.title: MDI to Planon Integration delta token not matching
entry.content:
We've recently established connection with Planon with S4 HANA Public Cloud. We've managed to push/pull some data.

Then I've tried to set up the BP resulting to recreating the MDI service instance.

After updating the credentials of impacted config, we can no longer sync to Planon. Planon says they are getting a delta token not matching error. They already tried restarting their app but still no go.

2025-12-10 17:23:48,100 [ERROR] [pnlog.APP.planonsoftware.com.planonrealestatemanagementforsap.servermodule.com.planon.sap.scheduledtask.SyncVersionIdsTask] Exception occured while executing SyncVersionIdsTask: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}} : com.planonsoftware.platform.backend.connector.v2.MessageDiscardException: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}}

What can we do with this issue?
